Trial_Design.evidence: This randomised controlled trial was conducted with nine healthy volunteers

Participants.evidence: nine healthy volunteers (6 males, 3 females; ages 29–55 years; BMI 20.2–31.3 kg/m²) in a clinical research setting

Intervention.evidence: Participants were assessed using X-ray velocimetry (XV) during tidal breathing and NIPPV with 15 cm H₂O inspiratory and 5 cm H₂O expiratory pressures

Objective.evidence: This study aimed to evaluate a non-contrast imaging method for assessing spatial lung volume displacement and its changes with non-invasive positive pressure ventilation (NIPPV) in healthy volunteers.

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was regional specific ventilation (SV) measured during tidal breathing and NIPPV.

Randomisation_Allocation.evidence: Randomisation and allocation concealment methods were not specified.

Number_Randomised.evidence: This randomised controlled trial was conducted with nine healthy volunteers

Number_Analysed.evidence: The analysis approach was not specified.

Result_Outcome.evidence: NIPPV increased MSV in both peripheral (p=0.01) and central (p=0.02) lung regions compared to tidal breathing.
